definition: a member of a legion, especially the French Foreign Legion

coming after a verb such as be, become, get, seem, look. Many adjectives, for example old can be either predicative as in The man is very old, or attributive as in an old man. Some, like asleep, can only be predicative.
used before a noun to describe it
a large crowd of people
old-fashioned; belonging to a time in the past
no longer used

large enough to walk into
not arranged in advance; where you do not need to arrange a time in advance
harmful or annoying to other people, or to society in general
not wanting to spend time with other people
the fact of making the development or progress of something slower
the state of having made less progress than normal
when you clench your hands, teeth, etc., or when they clench, you press them together tightly, usually showing that you are angry, determined or upset
to hold something tightly
to succeed in achieving or winning something
to provide the answer to something; to settle something that was not certain

to keep somebody as a prisoner and demand that other people pay you an amount of money before you set them free

a very large amount of money

that you can accept or agree with

not intended to cause harm or upset somebody

an act that goes beyond the limits of what is morally or legally acceptable
